column1: Kaspiysk (Russian: Каспи́йск; Lak: Ккасппи; Dargin; Lezgian; Avar: Каспийск) is a city in the Republic of Dagestan
column4: 18 kilometers (11 mi) southeast of Makhachkala. The 2010 Russian census recorded the city as being the fourth-largest in Dagestan. It is a working-class satellite-city to Makhachkala.

column1: The city is one of the newer urban centers in Dagestan. It began in 1932 as a worker's encampment
column2: servicing the needs of the nearby naval diesel engine manufacturer
column5: based upon the Russian word for "engine". During World War II
column6: the site saw much growth due to the war effort
column7: and became a center for major arms producers. In 1947
column8: the settlement received the status of a city
column9: and was given its current name
column10: reflecting its location on the shores of the Caspian Sea.

column3: 68 people were killed in a Chechen bomb attack targeting a military building.On May 9
column5: 43 people were killed in Chechen bomb attack on a Victory Day parade.

column1: Within the framework of administrative divisions
column2: it is incorporated as the City of Kaspiysk—an administrative unit with the status equal to that of the districts. As a municipal division
column3: the City of Kaspiysk is incorporated as Kaspiysk Urban Okrug.

column1: Predominant faiths of Kaspiysk city are Sunni Islam and Orthodox Christianity
The city belongs to the diocese of Makhachkala. Kaspiysk parish was formed in 1990 with the blessings of the Metropolitan of Stavropol and Baku
column2: and was officially registered in 1994. In 2000
column3: the community consecrated St. Kazan church.

column2: the Seventh Day Adventists dedicated a house of worship in the city. It became the target of two explosives attacks within two months.
founded in 1932. It produces diesel engines
column5: and other products for the Russian Navy.

column1: JSC Caspian Sea precision mechanics - machine-building factory
column2: founded in 1960. It manufactures maritime navigation equipment for military and commercial use.

column1: a stone processing factory.At the North side of the city is a seaport.
The city hosts the Anzhi Arena stadium
column2: home to the FC Anzhi Makhachkala Russian football club
column3: which competes in the Russian Football Premier League.

column1: The city was to bid to host the 2018 Summer Youth Olympics
column2: however the bid was abandoned due to a lack of government support.

column1: Kaspiysk has a cold semi-arid climate (Köppen climate classification: BSk).
The city is home to a large naval storage facility that houses Russian hovercraft and ekranoplans.
